title: Helping hand
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Agriculture - Economic aspects
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Food supply - Developing countries
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Food relief - Developing countries
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/International relief
description: Episode of Series "Heart of the matter". Explains how current EEC policy of dumping surpluss food on Third World Countries simply encourages governments to do nothing about their own problems and that cash aid is preferable as it can be used to directly improve the infrastructure. Also the logistics involved in the distribution of EEC surplus in Ethiopia.
